original: Arnolds, Gustav, konstnär, Ronnebv, f. 8/10/81 i Aringsås, Kronob. 1., av lantbr :insp. Gustaf Carlsson o. Maria Botilda Nilsson. — Elev v. KKH 05-09, stud. i Paris f. Cross o. Signac 11 samt i Akademie Russe 12. Bosatt i Paris. 21-30, utställde där i grupper samt på salonger, Salon d’automne första ggn 23, utställn. i Sthlm 30, 32 o. 44, Lund 34, Malmö 36 m. fl. platser. Repr. på mus. o. h. samlare.
translated: Arnolds, Gustav, artist, Ronnebv, born on October 8th, 1881 in Aringsås, Kronoburg County, the first child of farmer inspector Gustaf Carlsson and Maria Botilda Nilsson. He was a student at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts (KKH) from 1905-1909 and studied under Cross and Signac in Paris in 1911, as well as at the Academie Russe in 1912. He lived in Paris from 1921-30 and exhibited his works in group exhibitions and salons, including Salon d'Automne in 1923. He had solo exhibitions in Stockholm in 1930, 1932, and 1944, as well as Lund in 1934 and Malmö in 1936, among others. His works are represented in various museums and private collections.

additionalProperty.name: Represented in museums and private collections
